list_definition.definition: a large room for a formal dance

list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: The annual dinner dance will be held in the ballroom.

list_definition.mean_english: một kiểu khiêu vũ theo những nhịp điệu quy ước

list_ex_of_english: The established code of social ballroom dancing, with which many dancers became well acquainted in their youth, is that the man leads at all times.
Besides the more widespread availability of sequence dancing, there are other reasons for its greater popularity than ballroom dancing.
We found that at the venues where the predominant genre was ballroom, participants criticised other dancers and did not identify themselves with a group.
It was the presence of men in ballroom drag that is of interest here.
The complexities of ballroom dance pedagogy created significant obstacles for students who wished to learn the basics quickly.
At the masquerade, the eight men run into the ballroom at the stroke of midnight and scare the gathered revelers.
There is, one should note, less scope for mild or hidden subversion of the codes of social ballroom dancing.
The materials and finish give it the impression of a ballroom: velvet on the rear wall, red wall surfaces.
